subject: Ethics
title: Bribery and Corruption Worldwide
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Bribery and Corruption Worldwide.

hook.text: Siemens paid $1.4 billion in bribes across 30 countries. They had a department for it. With a budget.

buildup.text: The Foreign Corrupt Practices Act bans US companies from bribing foreign officials. The UK Bribery Act goes further.

discovery.text: Transparency International ranks countries by corruption. In many nations, bribery isn't a scandal. It's standard.

twist.text: Companies claim they can't compete without bribing. But corruption costs the global economy 5% of GDP every year.

climax.text: Anti-bribery enforcement is growing, but only 4 of 44 OECD countries actively enforce their own laws.

punchline.text: The cost of corruption isn't the bribe. It's everything it breaks.

quiz.question: What does the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act prohibit?
options: US companies from bribing foreign government officials
Foreign companies from doing business in the United States
